entity.name: `<Fragment>`
entity.description: `<Fragment>`, often used via `<>...</>` syntax, lets you group elements without a wrapper node.

entity.name: `memo`
entity.description: `memo` lets you skip re-rendering a component when its props are unchanged.
entity.descriptionClean: memo lets you skip re-rendering a component when its props are unchanged.
entity.descriptionHtml: memo lets you skip re-rendering a component when its props are unchanged.

example.codeHighlighted: const MemoizedComponent = memo(SomeComponent, arePropsEqual?)

entity.descriptionHtml: <Profiler> lets you measure rendering performance of a React tree programmatically.

entity.name: `<StrictMode>`

entity.descriptionHtml: <StrictMode> lets you find common bugs in your components early during development.

entity.name: `act`
entity.description: `act` is a test helper to apply pending React updates before making assertions.
entity.descriptionClean: act is a test helper to apply pending React updates before making assertions.
entity.descriptionHtml: act is a test helper to apply pending React updates before making assertions.

example.codeHighlighted: it ('renders with button disabled', async () => { await act(async () => { root.render(<TestComponent />) }); expect(container.querySelector('button')).toBeDisabled(); });

entity.name: `useCallback`
entity.description: `useCallback` is a React Hook that lets you cache a function definition between re-renders.

entity.descriptionHtml: useCallback is a React Hook that lets you cache a function definition between re-renders.

entity.name: `useMemo`

entity.name: `startTransition`

entity.name: `useActionState` (formerly `useFormState`)

entity.name: `<form> Actions`
entity.description: Pass a function to the action prop of form to run the function when the form is submitted.
entity.descriptionClean: Pass a function to the action prop of form to run the function when the form is submitted.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pass a function to the action prop of form to run the function when the form is submitted.

example.codeHighlighted: export default function Search() { function search(formData) { const query = formData.get("query"); alert(`You searched for '${query}'`); } return ( <form action={search}> <input name="query" /> <button type="submit">Search</button> </form> ); }

entity.name: `useEffectEvent`
